Mobiles.LongDescription: `iA fiery litan slave stands here, looking starved.``
`aA drow commoner patrols the streets for unwanted intruders.``
Mobiles.Description: Eyes glitter coldly in a face of blue so deep as to almost be black, asthis commoner alertly surveys the area.  The easy familiarity with the wornweaponry carried and almost paranoid watchfulness of this commoner indicatesthey are unlikely to give directions.  A discreet house badge perches on oneshoulder.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aA dark, rich-looking drow waits to make his sacrifice to `iLloth`a.``
`aA `bred`a-`brobed`a noble stands here waiting to make a sacrifice to `iLloth`a.``
`aA long-robed, gold adorned drow noble stands here idly.``
`aA dark, robed figure stands here chanting in an unknown language.``
The drow weapons master is here shadow boxing.
Mobiles.Description: He definitely knows his way around in combat.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aA frail, female drow sits in deep meditation.``
The matron mother of the first house is waiting for you.
Mobiles.Description: She looks like she is about to rip your head off and eat it.

Mobiles.LongDescription: A yochlol appears suddenly, extracting itself out of a swirling mist.
Mobiles.Description: The yochlol is not in a good mood.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aAn armored drow guard is here.``
Mobiles.Description: This soldier has been impeccably trained in the drow academy, and thediscipline (and perhaps a little fear?)  Instilled in him there is obviousin the rigidly correct stance in which he holds his weapon.  Not good enoughto be an officer, nor a mage, he is clearly intent on taking out hisfrustration on you.

Mobiles.LongDescription: The drow scout is here sneaking among the shadows.
Mobiles.Description: The drow scout blends so well with her environment, you barely see her form.

Mobiles.LongDescription: A dirty human child wanders around here, wailing quietly.
Mobiles.Description: Captured by drow enslavers many months ago, this child is being kept inbondage until he is of the age when he can work.

Mobiles.LongDescription: A soldier of the First House drills mindlessly.
Mobiles.Description: This soldier, like all the other soldiers of the First House, wears adark uniform with the badge of a spider perched above the symbol of, youassume, the First House.

Mobiles.LongDescription: A goblin slave sullenly sweeps the street of refuse.
Mobiles.Description: A foul goblin sullenly cleans the street.  His piggish eyes are downcastand his unfriendly demeanor clearly indicates his lack of joy with hiscurrent lot in life.  The way that he cringes as you look at him, however,convinces you that he has been well disciplined by his evil drow masters.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aA dark elf soldier drills here with his troop.``
Mobiles.Description: This loyal dark elf soldier drills endlessly, hoping for the day that thedark elves will spill out of their underground seclusion and destroy theircousins of the light.  In the meantime, he is perfectly happy to drill andpractice his skills in the dangerous games of dark elf politics.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aCurled deep within the blankets of one cot, a dark elf sleeps soundly.``
Mobiles.Description: Undoubtedly tired from a long day of wickedness, this dark elf sleepssoundly.  Perhaps you should let the dark elf get their rest, as this raceis not known for their pleasant disposition even when awake.  Like otherelves, however, you notice the graceful elven beauty that these denizens ofdarkness share with their cousins of the light.  ``

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aA dark elf priestess doesn't appreciate being disturbed while dressing.``
Mobiles.Description: Mmmm.  Nice.  You obviously disturbed her before she could put on thevoluminous robe of a cleric on over her undershift.  Her half-undressedstate forcefully reminds you of the close relationship with the surfaceelves that these dark elves have.  Of course, she's pretty upset that youdisturbed her while dressing so you aren't given much time to examine herassets closely.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `fA human slave lies here helplessly, slowly `bbleeding`f to death.``
Mobiles.Description: Although he is now covered in filth and wasted from the lack of propernutrition, you can tell easily that this young man was once a smith by hislarge build and the numerous burn marks on his hands and wrists.  Now, ofcourse, weakened and poisoned by the evil around him, he is barely able todo much more than raise his long suffering eyes to beg you to kill himquickly, and release him from his torment.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aA small dark elf child huddles here in a corner.``
Mobiles.Description: `aLife is often cruel, as this young child already knows.  This littleelf is small for their age and no doubt mercilessly picked on by the largerand stronger dark elf children.  Dark elves have few children, and fewerstill live to adulthood, thanks to the rigorous training and evil inherentin the dark elf culture.  ``

Mobiles.LongDescription: `fA gang of dark elf children have banded together to look for small animals to torture.``
Mobiles.Description: Dark elf children grow up quickly...  And these children have alreadylearned it's safest for them to roam in numbers.  Right now, they arelooking for something to torture, especially small animals, smallerchildren, or anything weak enough that crosses their line of sight.  Suchaggression is encouraged among the dark elves, though as they grow older,they will be forced to be more subtle.

Mobiles.LongDescription: A menacing figure swathed in black, the drow master stares at you angrily.
Mobiles.Description: The drow master is ALWAYS ready for a fight.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aGeneral Shaladar oversees his occupation from here.``
`aShaladar's elite bodyguard stops anyone from getting to him.``
`aA drow sentry is here, blocking access to Shaladar.``
`aA drow scout stands in the square shouting propaganda.``
`aAn elite drow guard is here, protecting the Scout.``
`aThe drow imperial vanguard is boarding up the entrance to the healer's shop.``
`aA drow sentry guards the gate.``
`aA drow sentry guards the gate.``
`aA drow sentry guards the gate.``
`aA drow sentry guards the gate.``
`aA drow soldier patrols the streets to keep Thesden under control.``
`aAn elite drow guard stands between you and the exit to the cathedral.``
`aA drow soldier patrols the streets to keep Thesden under control.``
`dA dwarven slave sits in the corner digging at the floor.``
`aAn emaciated kalian slave stares at you with `ib`bloodlusted`a eyes.``
A human slave is busy looking for a way out of the pen.
`aA sinister elf stands guard in front of the slave pen.``
`aA robed figure sits praying in an unknown language.``
`a An eight-legged ghost spider hovers just above the ground.``
`mA crazy slave is bashing his head against the wall.``

Rooms.TpMsg: `aYou've found your way into a dark and evil place.  Pray you make it out alive.``
Rooms.RoomDescription: The coolness of a vast underground cavern descends upon you.  Thedarkness is slightly disorienting at first, but your eyes soon adjust to thelow lighting afforded by your lighting device.  A massive gate of`cadamantite`a lies open to the west.  Beyond it crouches a huge, silentcity.  Shadowy forms move here and there through the streets.  ````

Ornately carved stone buildings line the street, a dizzying array ofarches and towers and spires.  The road itself is made from carefully shapedand fitted stones, of varying colors to form a subtly elegant pattern.  Tothe east, a large, `cadamantite`a gate has been left open.  West crouches agloomy looking structure.  North and south the road continues.  ``

The road bends sharply.  Northward the buildings tower, nearly touchingthe top of the massive cavern.  From here you can see the lights glimmeringin their high windows.  West the city of the drow continues, but thebuildings that way are not quite so beautiful or imposing.

Crowds of silent drow fill the street.  When the throng shifts you catcha glimpse of an open archway which leads into a nicely made building to thesouth.  Symbols on a nearby post indicate this to be the `e3rd House`a.  Theroad extends both east and west.  ``

Rooms.RoomName: The Third House of Drow City
Rooms.RoomDescription: The 3rd house of the drow is of comfortable size and decoration.  Themurals covering the walls are a bit sloppy, with some colors bleedingtogether.  The statues are of good line but rough in finish.  An open doorleads further inward to the south.  To the north the street runs past.

This cave is a small, secure enclosure with a ``throne`a carved into thewall.  The walls have been hewn from rock and seem to be glowing with astrange red light.  There is a small, black offering ``altar`a, wherecommoners can make sacrifices to please their gods.  There is a gutter oneither side of the cave, where water seeping through the ceiling, is meantto be diverted to.  The floor seems to be made of sharp, crushed, blackstone, and gleams in the dim light.  ``

A few drow walk past, mostly scurrying to the east, where the road seemsbusier.  North stands a wide, low building, shockingly devoid of ornament.In this lavishly decorated city, the very plainness of the building sends anunmistakeable message.

The road comes to a quiet end here between two drow noble houses.  To thenorth a narrow path allows access to the gate of the `g1st House`l.Southward the doors of the smaller `g2nd House`l stand open wide.  Theavenue extends back to the east.  ``

Rooms.RoomName: The Second House of Drow City
Rooms.RoomDescription: The 2nd house stands about you, large and beautiful.  Well done murals byskilled artists cover the walls.  Large, creepy statues of spiders occupyeach corner of the room.  Tasteful furniture offers comfort.  An openarchway leads further in to the west.  North lies the quiet street.

A vast, dim room opens around you.  In the center stands a throne of`aglittering silver, shining in the faint torchlight from its imposingperch atop a high dais.  A black altar, shaped like a hunting spider,crouches before the throne with streaks of fresh blood streaming downits legs.  ``

You stand before a huge gate made of wrought black metal, nearly as largeas the one which guarded the city's entrance.  It stands open, allowing freeaccess to the `g1st House `l- which shines beyond it in magnificentsplendor.  `lSouth a narrow path leads to a street, northward a busy roadextends.  ``

Candlelight glows from the massive chandelier, suspended high above fromthe vaulted ceiling in this elegant chamber.  Its warm light reveals a roomfilled with finely worked furniture, all of rarest woods.  Upon the walls,exquisite paintings hang, the largest and most elaborate a portrait of the`fspider queen`l, which rests above a set of double doors to the west.  Eastleads back out to the gate.  ``

Your footsteps echo coldly about the throne room of the 1st house.  Vastand dark, only two objects reside within: throne and altar.  The thronelooks to be made of `kpure gold`l, finely wrought into delicate curves andwhorls, with cushions of `fviolet silk`l.  Before the throne, the hugespider-shaped altar looks ready to pounce on you.  All six of its eyes havebeen cut from flawless `irubies`l.  ``

This is the council chamber for the Matron Mother herself.  A huge tableand chairs surrounding it sits in the center of the room.  North of here,a strange rusted door looks as if it is stuck in place, and you can hearwails coming from inside.

A wide east-west avenue is intercepted by a north-south street here.Many fine, graceful edifices line the spotless streets, but all are shut andbarred to keep the rabble like you out.  Southward the road leads to amagnificent gate.  ``

The small street ends here, continuing back to the south.  To the west,looms a large tower, its facade smothered in finely detailed stone carvings.Bright banners hang along either side of the doorway.  An air of calm andrefreshment flows outward from its open doors.  ``

This room makes even the Mages' Academy look plain.  A mosaic of preciousstones covers the floor, forming mystic patterns.  The walls are smoothwhite marble, with inlaid gold and sliver tracery echoing the lines in thefloor.  Delicate curved benches, thickly gilded and gleaming, provide spacesfor the clerics to relax.

Here the fine street is mostly occupied by commoners and priestesses, asthey flow in and out of the massive temple to the north.  A low sound ofchanting drifts out through the open doors, sending a chill through you.The street continues both east and west.  ``

This wide, low room is completely bare of ornament, unless the dark,ominous stains on the walls and floors can be considered decorative.  Crudestools, rudely constructed with little care and less patience, are scatteredhere in there.  This dark elf training room is obviously not used by thesqueamish.

Rooms.RoomName: Entrance to the Temple of Lloth
Rooms.RoomDescription: The largest building in the city, the temple is beyond belief.  Even itsdoors stretch the limits of your imagination with the fantastic andgrotesquely intriguing carvings of spiders and various forms of prey,including what looks like humanoids.  Peering in the temple entrance, youcan see that the walls are made of gold and adamantite.

Great wealth and attention have been lavished on this tower.  Nothing hasbeen spared for this school devoted to what the drow consider the highest ofthe arts- `fmagic`l.  The finest of handmade tapestries line the walls.  Thefloor is of polished, bright blue stone, flecked with gold.  Heavy, carven,dark wood chairs have been set along the perimeter of the room for pupils towait in.  South is the exit out to the streets.  ``

Although these streets are busy, all is silent, as the distrustful darkelves move efficiently through their elegantly chilling city.  East andwest, this lane continues.  Northward, a high, dark tower reeks of magic,and to the south gloom emanates from a small, dark structure.

`a The entire western wall of this cave is a jumbled mass of wooden barsbehind which, stand dozens of slaves all waiting to be bought or sold to thehighest bidder.  The ground is rough, crushed rock and the air smells likedirty hair and fecal matter.  The slaves in the pen look less than healthy.Perhaps you could score a good deal.  ``

A haughty drow woman glares at you with disdain as she sweeps past,dragging her weakly struggling slave behind.  The street bends here,leading west and south.  To the north lies the `e4th House`a, small compared tothe other buildings around.  ``

Rooms.RoomName: The Fourth House of Drow City
Rooms.RoomDescription: This small room has been constructed of large stone blocks that arerather plain and not very well fitted.  Some rugs of inferior workmanshipline the floor.  The old, worn furniture seems like it was probably niceonce.  To the east an opening leads to another room.  South is the way out.

Very similar in quality and decoration to the other room of the 4thHouse, the throne room is distinguished by a large, worn throne on a wobblydais, sitting behind a plain stone altar.  Clearly the wealth and glory ofthe 4th house are not much to be impressed with.
You stand in the entrance way to the temple which opens up to the northinto a large hallway going east and west. Small statues of spiders line theentrance way's walls.

You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engravedwith pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As youlook down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.To the north is a obsidian stairway.

You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engravedwith pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As youlook down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.

You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engravedwith pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As youlook down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.To the north is a door.

You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engravedwith pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As youlook down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.

You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engravedwith pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As youlook down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.

Lined with adamantite, this long hallway trails away into furtherdarkness.  The walls are engraved with pictures of elves and spiders,difficult to see in the poor light.  The hall continues east and west, andfurther away, one or two figures move away.  A large, thick door barricadesthe south.

Although you would expect the room of warriors to be a complete mess,this bunk room is surprisingly tidy.  Drow soldiers are too well disciplinedto permit their belongings to be disordered - besides, how would they thenknow if someone had snooped in their belongings?  All of the beds are madein military fashion, and personal belongings, if any exist, have been storedout of sight.

You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engravedwith pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As youlook down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.
You are standing at the bottom of a giant obsidian and adamantitestairway. The edges are trimmed with gold.

You are standing in the middle of a grand hallway.  The walls are of thepurest adamantite with gold trim.  Grisly mosaics line the walls, detailingsubjects such as dismemberment with the fine delicacy typical of elvenartwork - even though the subject is disgusting.

The mage's living quarters is rather clean with the exception of a fewused component containers.  It is rather well decorated as well.  Cots linethe floor for the mages to sleep on.  Shimmering veils about each cotcuriously muffle all sound.  The only door is to the east.
You are walking down a grand hallway, heavily decorated with adamantiteand gold. To the north the hall goes down a flight of stairs while a door istoo the west.

This large bed chamber is home to many low-ranking dark elf clerics.  Ithas all the accoutrements of a home: beds, a colorful rug, and knick-knacks.Of course, the rug displays a scene of a brutal sacrifice of children, andthe knick-knacks are primarily instruments of torture and small religious`iicons``.
You are climbing a set of obsidian stairs surrounded by adamantite walls.To the north are a set of large golden doors.
This is the south side of a large auditorium used for services by thedrow priestesses. In the center is a large sacrificial pit and beyond that isan altar.
You are on the eastern side of the chamber overlooking the pit. To the eastis a door while to the north is an altar.
A you climb down into the pit thousands of spiders cover you tearing yourbody to shreds.Lloth thanks you for your sacrifice.You've fallen, and you can't get up!!!

You are standing in front of a highly and freshly `xbloodstained altar`l.Engraved on the top of the altar is a giant spider with a drow head.Looking down from the altar you see a large sacrificial pit.
This is the main room to the cell chambers for the slaves to besacrificed. You notice there are no guards around.

Rotten meat and breads lie about the floor while shackles hang from thewalls.  The room reeks of death and extended abuse.  You become nauseous asyou realize you are obviously too late to save at least one slave.
You stand upon a dais behind the altar. Above you is a enormous illusionof a female drow turning into a giant spider and back again. There is a doorto the west.

This room, based on the amount of security you had to go through to gethere, is obviously meant to temporarily store treasure.  Right now, it israther bare of all save a dented cup or two that looks as if they might havebeen forgotten when a larger treasure was removed.
This one person bedchamber is very elegant. The owner must be held in highto get this kind of treatment.
A pinhole scraped out of the ceiling lets in a sliver of dim light froman unnatural source above.  The rusted door keeping this room hidden fromplain sight seems to swing brokenly.

Rooms.RoomName: Drilling Grounds of the First House
Rooms.RoomDescription: A courtyard spreads out before you, the stone floor marred with burnmarks and countless scuff marks.  A troop of drow soldiers are drillinghere, the private army of the most powerful house of the underground realmof the evil dark elves.

A wide east-west avenue terminates here in a quiet little cul de sac ofhomes.  Many fine, graceful edifices line the spotless streets, but all areshut and barred to keep the rabble like you out.  Passing drow look at yoususpiciously as they hurry about their business.

Rooms.MaxMsg: There's no way you can fit in there! Nobody is THAT agile!
Rooms.RoomDescription: `aThis small, dark room has the musty smell of a room that has been shutup for a long time.  From the litter on the floor and the footmarks in thedust, you can tell that someone recently started using this room again.  Itlooks like a nice place to rest, away from the pressures of the evil cityoutside.  ``

`a   The room is bare and plain, bits of trash and nameless debris strewn allabout.  The smell of unwashed bodies and the ragged roar of many sleeperssnoring fills the air.  Straw bedding on the floor softens, at least alittle, the beds of the unfortunate creatures who have fallen prey to Drowimperialism.  Exits lead north and east out to the city streets.``

Objects.Name: longsword commoner
Objects.LongDescription: A commoner's longsword made of adamantite has been left here.

Objects.Name: longsword noble
Objects.LongDescription: A drow noble's longsword made of adamantite lies here.

Objects.Name: whip snake two-headed
Objects.LongDescription: A whip with two snakes heads lies here.

Objects.Name: whip snake three-headed
Objects.LongDescription: A whip with three snake heads has been left here.

Objects.Name: whip snake four-headed
Objects.LongDescription: A whip with four snake heads has been left here.

Objects.Name: longsword black
Objects.LongDescription: `aA black longsword has been carelessly left here.``

Objects.Name: whip snake five-headed
Objects.LongDescription: A whip with five snake heads is lying here.

Objects.Name: whip snake six-headed
Objects.LongDescription: A whip with six snake heads has been dropped here.

Objects.Name: mithril bracer
Objects.LongDescription: A mithril bracer has been dropped here.

Objects.Name: mithril gauntlets
Objects.LongDescription: A pair of gauntlets has been dropped here.

Objects.Name: wand blue silver
Objects.LongDescription: A silvery blue wand has been dropped in the dirt.

Objects.Name: runed leather cloak
Objects.LongDescription: `aA long leather cloak with small archaic runes scribed upon it, lies here.``

Objects.Name: ring ruby
Objects.LongDescription: `hA small `bruby `hring lies in the dirt.``

Objects.Name: dagger sacrificial spider
Objects.LongDescription: A dagger with spider leg shaped blades lies on the ground.

Objects.Name: hat green
Objects.LongDescription: `hA small bright `jgreen `hhat lies in the dirt.``

Objects.Name: adamantite knife sacrificial
Objects.LongDescription: A short knife made of adamantite lies here.

Objects.Name: thin adamantite club
Objects.LongDescription: `hA long, thin club with metallic spikes at the end lies here.``

Objects.Name: adamantite tipped staff
Objects.LongDescription: `dA long wooden staff with blunt metal ends lies here.``

Objects.Name: short adamantite throwing axe
Objects.LongDescription: `hA tiny axe made of pure `cadamantite `hlies here.``

Objects.Name: three headed flail
Objects.LongDescription: A short club with three small balls chained to it lies here.

Objects.Name: broadsword commoner
Objects.LongDescription: A commoner's broadsword made of adamantite has been left here.

Objects.Name: dirty rattle
Objects.LongDescription: A dirty rattle lies here, battered and used.

Objects.Name: pacifier
Objects.LongDescription: A long rubber cone sits here.

Objects.Name: silver wand
Objects.LongDescription: A rod of silver lies here.

Objects.Name: slave human corpse
Objects.LongDescription: The wasted and withered remains of a human slave are beginning to rot.

Objects.Name: lloth spider statue
Objects.LongDescription: `bAn image of Lloth continually shifts between woman, spider, and a mix of the two.``

Objects.Name: dented cup
Objects.LongDescription: `hDented and battered, a `kgolden cup`h lies carelessly discarded on the ground.``

Objects.Name: scraggly broom
Objects.LongDescription: `dA `zscraggly broom`d has been tossed carelessly aside here.``

Objects.Name: gleaming sword
Objects.LongDescription: `aA gleaming sword of polished metal suggests evil here.``

Objects.Name: cot mage
Objects.LongDescription: `gA comfortable looking but narrow cot is here.``

Objects.Name: cleric bed
Objects.LongDescription: `fThe unmade bed of a cleric indicates someone was recently here.``

Objects.Name: spider statue
Objects.LongDescription: `bOne `ispider statue`b is slightly out of alignment with the others.``

Objects.Name: hidden door
Objects.LongDescription: `aThe faint outlines of a hidden door are barely visible here.``

Objects.Name: wand adamantite
Objects.LongDescription: `cAn adamantite wand has `irunes`c carved in it.``

Objects.Name: hole
Objects.LongDescription: `lA hole almost as wide as your body is in the corner of the floor here, with more and more spiders crawling out of it by the minute.``

Objects.Name: sharp adamantite lancet
Objects.LongDescription: `oA wide cutting blade has a soft `cgreen `oglow to it.``

Objects.Name: portal
Objects.LongDescription: The third magical `kquest`` portal is slowly fading away.

Objects.Name: key slave pen
Objects.LongDescription: A wooden key that opens the slave pen is lying here.

Objects.Name: spiderstat statue
Objects.LongDescription: `aA large statue of a spider is perched perilously upon a pedestal.``

Objects.Name: fog armor mist
Objects.LongDescription: `aA mysterious swirling mist is here reeking of undeath.``

Objects.Name: suit jester warped
Objects.LongDescription: A heap of inflated balloons in the shapes of animals.
